result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie M Kruczkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

STAYED.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED. COSTS PAID IN FULL.
DNA surcharge WAIVED.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Stephanie M Kruczkowski in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 4.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 4:
- 1 year jail straight time STAYED for  2 years Probation - 7 days credit if revoked
- Court Costs of $268.00 - apply bail and refund balance  
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. Defendant to perform 30 hours of community service.  Defendant to provide DNA sample.
 -  20 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time at the discretion of the Agent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Stephanie M Kruczkowski in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS report addressed. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court will put the matter over to next week.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defense requests another date.  Defendant to may go into drug treatment program.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

COURT ORDERED A $500.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $1000.00 SIGNATURE BOND PREVIOUSLY IMPOSED AND SIGNED.  Defendant to reside with her parents. Defendant to report to WCS 3 times per week. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Stephanie M Kruczkowski in court, in custody, with attorney Sam Benedict for Katie B. Bricco.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Non-compliance of WCS letter addressed. Court will give another date in 2 weeks.  Hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Stephanie M Kruczkowski in court with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective William M. from the City of New Berlin was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Redirect by the state. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects to bind over.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Court addresses the non-compliance letter from WCS and does not modify the bail. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Stephanie M Kruczkowski in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant presents statements to the court regarding her actions with WCS. Court does not take any action on the bail. Bail remains as fixed and she is to continue with WCS.  Court date of 01/08 remains as set.

Preliminary hearing on January 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Stephanie M Kruczkowski in court with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to Dismiss Count #4 filed by Atty. Bricco. Statements presented. State makes statements to the Court objecting to dismiss Count #4. State will be filing an amended complaint with field testing results. Court allows State to file the Amended Complaint. Court denies the Motion to Dismiss. State to file Amended Complaint by December 1, 2014.  If State does not file Amended Complaint by December 1, 2014 Count #4 will be dismissed.   Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
